title: Excellent private walking tour and meal in Bucharest.
body: This private one on one Discover Bucharest Highlights and Food Tour was excellent. Made especially wonderful by our tour guide Elana (pronounced Ejuana). As a native Bucharest resident and highly educated double master student in history, she was extremely knowledgeable in this field and carried out this tour to perfection. The finishing touch was an excellent Romanian 3 course meal. I highly recommend this tour and hope you get Elana as your guide.

title: Amazing Game of Thrones Tour
body:
What an awesome tour we had on Tuesday 18 June with our very knowledgeable guide - Doris, from Urban Adventures. I highly recommend this tour around the Old City of Dubrovnik and Lovrenjac Fort. It made me feel as though I had been transported back in time. With Doris providing detailed descriptions of the scenes filmed at each of the locations and having a photo showing
the actual scene just made you feel as though you were on set. Doris was patient and answered all questions asked and also provided some interesting bits of information about the actors that she had met during their stay in Dubrovnik. The tour group was small enough so that we all felt that we were receiving individual attention.
Most enjoyable.

title: Great walking tour in Quito.
body: Luis was my guide and he was amazing! He shared the food, culture, and the history of Ecuador and Quito with me on this walking tour. I appreciated his desire to show off the city he was born in. I was the only one on this tour on a Wednesday morning. I don't speak Spanish, so it was great to speak to someone who spoke English fluently and could translate for me at the same time. I would highly recommend this tour.

title: Taste of Morocco for a night
body: The tour Was really a very small group. Just me and the guide JIHAD!! It was quick and informative. So We had moroccan mint tea wirh local naan bread, sardine sandwich, local minestrone soup, kuskus, some desserts. Food in General Was bland for my personal taste. But Thats How they do it here. Interesting How the local moroccan desserts are reallu sweet, bees were ALL over the dessert shop. . Its good to have a tour Like this to sample ALL the little food that I wouldnt normally try on my own. Was expecting little portions, But Was more than full after the tour. Thanks for the wonderful food tour

title: Highly recommend ??
body:
First time visiting Thailand as a solo traveler. I was extremely surprised to find I was the only participant for the afternoon excursion. My guide Art was absolutely wonderful!!! He was extremely knowledgeable, answered all of my questions, and was so kind.

The EV Tuk Tuk was a great way to explore different parts of Bangkok in the oppressive heat. We also took a quick river ride to visit the very cool flower market that is open 24 hrs.

My favorite spots included the Wang Lang market and Ban Bu community.
Art even made an extra stop to highlight a local temple where imagery was used in the White Lotus. Such a fun fact!!!

Thank you Art for sharing a wonderful day and showcasing some amazing parts of your country’s rich culture ????????

title: Highly recommend this tour—and especially Kaffey—for anyone visiting New Orleans!
body:
We had an absolutely fantastic food tour of the French Quarter with Kaffey! From the moment we met, her warm personality and deep knowledge of New Orleans history made the experience so much more than just tasting incredible food. She wove fascinating stories about the city’s culture and traditions into every stop, helping us appreciate the roots of each dish we tried.

The food itself was outstanding—everything from iconic classics to hidden local gems we never would have found on our own. Kaffey paced the tour perfectly, making sure we had time to enjoy each bite while still keeping the energy and excitement going.

Highly recommend this tour—and especially Kaffey—for anyone visiting New Orleans!

title: Very yummy and authentic experience!
body:
What an experience!

My family and I had a great time with Komang. We loved going to the night food market and trying some traditional Balinese dishes. They were all really yummy and unique.

Komang spoke incredible English and was very friendly. He even taught us some phrases in the local Balinese language. He was very kind and attentive, ensuring we had everything we needed at all times.

This was a brilliant tour and is definitely something you should do if you’re looking for an authentic and local experience.

title: More $ per $
body: Don't think twice before registering for this awesome Boston Seafood Tour! The tour takes you to the oldest family-run seafood restaurants; the history of seaport is woven around these enterprising individuals and families who have stood their ground firmly against the capitalist food chains. Nabil made the tour one of the memorable ones with his charm, humour, in-depth knowledge about the history of the Boston seaport and most importantly, his personal contacts with the seaport community! I am a seafoodie and the clam chowder, bluefin tuna sushi, and lobster roll served to us was one of the best quality seafoods I've ever had. At the end of the 2.5 hours trip you feel amazed to see a different 'America' and non-touristy Boston that is not often talked about.

title: An Exceptional Local Food Tour
body:

The food was delicious and we also got to learn more about how its made and popular places where the locals have it, it was a lovely way to explore more of the city, learn about the culture all with amazing company and great food.

title: A great way to see the must-sees of Bangkok
body: This was a great tour with guide Pam who had so much knowledge about everything, we learnt so much and she was a lot of fun. We booked the tour for four of us. The meeting point was easy to find and the tour started with a longboat ride where we saw basking lizards and fed catfish. We then disembarked and walked a short walk to The Grand Palace which was incredible in its opulence and history. The Emerald Buddha was in its winter coverings. We then jumped on an air con bus to Wat Pho to see the incredible Reclining Buddha. It is hard to find words to describe these places, they have to be seen. We finished with a cafe stop. I am glad we did this tour early in the morning before it gets too hot and too crowded. Pam took care of all the entry tickets. Perhaps the only thing that could have made it better would be to do the longboat ride in between the two venues to have a breather. But the tour is only 4 hours!

title: A unique trip to Teotihuacan from Mexico City
body:
Went on May 9th to see Teotihuacan, and I happened to be the only guest attending the tour! The trip was super interesting and unconventional, we started by using public transport to go from the city center to a bus hub and then took an overland bus to go straight to the ruins - including some introduction to the surrounding area and vendors / musicians live on the bus :D.
Arriving at Teotihuacan it definitely pays to have a knowledgeable guide and I learned a whole lot about the history and culture of the place, including opportunities to look at some in-depth archeology in the attached museum. Notably, we also visited a local shop with produce and the obsidian crafts that played a role in the history of this area. The trip ends with homemade Mexican food at a local home, which was very yummy!
My tour guide was super friendly and communicative both in English and Spanish and clearly well informed about Teotihuacan as well as every place along the way!
We went back on the bus and I returned to my place with no issues. Would definitely recommend the tour for anybody looking to see Teotihuacan based in Mexico City, this is the coolest way to do it!

title: Such an interesting tour
body: We had a great private tour with Babis who is so knowledgeable about his home town of Athens. We started in the markets then walked through old Athens and Plaka finishing at the Acropolis museum. All the time Babis talked about the history of Athens, showed us old ruins, explained their timeline and pointed out the different architecture throughout the city. We even had a coffee stop at a rooftop restaurant with an incredible view over old Athens towards the Acropolis. I can definitely recommend this tour as part of your Athens experience

title: The best part of my weekend trip.
body: The best thing about food tours is you don't need to search 'great restaurants near me' or 'authentic Viennese food near me.' The guide takes you to the best of the best, showing you interesting stops, chatting about the culture and history and taking you beyond the tourist hot spots to absolute gems. The food was amazing - do not eat before you go! Peter was so knowledgeable about the history and culture of Vienna and spent more time and energy on us than he needed to! Thanks to him I could use public transport confidently, so thank you Peter!

body:

full review:
Manuel I
3 contributions
0
A unique trip to Teotihuacan from Mexico City
May 2024 • Solo
Went on May 9th to see Teotihuacan, and I happened to be the only guest attending the tour! The trip was super interesting and unconventional, we started by using public transport to go from the city center to a bus hub and then took an overland bus to go straight to the ruins - including some introduction to the surrounding area and vendors / musicians live on the bus :D.
Arriving at Teotihuacan it definitely pays to have a knowledgeable guide and I learned a whole lot about the history and culture of the place, including opportunities to look at some in-depth archeology in the attached museum. Notably, we also visited a local shop with produce and the obsidian crafts that played a role in the history of this area. The trip ends with homemade Mexican food at a local home, which was very yummy!
My tour guide was super friendly and communicative both in English and Spanish and clearly well informed about Teotihuacan as well as every place along the way!
We went back on the bus and I returned to my place with no issues. Would definitely recommend the tour for anybody looking to see Teotihuacan based in Mexico City, this is the coolest way to do it!

AMAZING MUST-DO TOUR !!!!
May 2025 • Family
Our group of 4 loved this tour! We did a city tour afterward and it felt so boring in comparison. This one was fun, interesting, unique, and full of cool stories. If you're visiting Kensington/Chinatown, you have to do this - without it, you'd miss the deep history and meaning behind what you're seeing. You would miss out on a lot.. Kieran gave us a deeper appreciation for the area - the beautiful art (!!) , the history, and the stories behind the buildings and people.

Kieran was a FANTASTIC guide - friendly, funny, welcoming, and a great speaker & storyteller. He shared so many meaningful stories and fun facts. We loved it! Made the tour so interesting and fun!

One thing to note: the tour says 3 hours, but if your group is small, it might be shorter. That didn’t bother us at all - we care more about quality than the exact length. It still felt full and complete.

The pace was great too. I liked that it wasn’t rushed and had a good balance of walking, listening, and a little resting. I also loved the coffee shop Kieran took us to—it was quirky, fun, and sparked some conversation and laughs… (but I won't give away the details!)

This tour is more for people who enjoy something unique, fun..... especially if you appreciate diverse cultures, local history, and understanding how a neighborhood came to be the way it is. It’s not your average city tour, and that’s what makes it so special and fun.

Overall, a beautiful, memorable experience!

title: A decent tour into the QVM
body:
I took this tour as part of a free promotion, but I believe it's decently priced at $75, given the small group size and the included tastings like an oyster, a borek, and gelato.

As a local, it was hard to be impressed by a tour of the Queen Victoria Market, but I did learn a few new things, which was a pleasant surprise.

However, the tour's framing felt misleading. While the market itself is multicultural, the tour was not.

The guide's approach to food could be seen a culturally insensitive. The guide showed little knowledge or appreciation for certain cuisines, describing them with a hint of disdain that could easily offend. This was highlighted by her judgmental tone when she discussed the market's 'unhygienic' past, a comment that seemed to ignore the reality of how many traditional wet markets operate worldwide.
On the converse the guide celebrated European food with great enthusiasm.

In the end, the tour felt whitewashed and failed to genuinely celebrate the market's diversity.
Slightly disappointed in Intrepid and perhaps some unconcious bias training is in order.
(As in the guide probably didn't even realise how they could come across to some people.)

Also I felt it was worthwhile to mention that the the guide also showed little empathy for three small business's that are in the precinct with a purpose that secretly they want displaced / relocated to allow other social enterprises that space. Sure I get it, but they're small business owners too.

body: Despite the insane heat, we had a very entertaining and enthusiastic guide. She was considerate of our “land speed” and our need to follow whatever shade she could find. Athens brought to life!
We had a fantastic tour last Tuesday 15th September with Babis.

We thoroughly enjoyed learning/experiencing some of the old history, religious buildings, architecture, neighbourhoods and ruins of the city and experiencing the sights and smells of the many markets on offer. All brought to life by Babis, who’s knowledge was remarkable and really went the extra mile to show us more for his beautiful city.

It was also a great tour to do on our first day, to find our bearings and gain a geography of all the landmarks. A welcome coffee break was included halfway through on a rooftop cafe overlooking Monastiraki Square, with great views of the Acropolis - a very nice touch.

Thank you urban adventures and thank you Babis.

title: Our time in Athens was wonderful and then some!
body:
Our first trip to Athens in late September/early October was an absolutely wonderful adventure.

We flew over on Turkish Airlines, which treated us very well; their customer service, flight crew and Business Lounge (in Istanbul through which which we connected) were exceptional.

The car service we used from airport to hotel and back was provided by Welcome Tours; punctual, reasonably priced and very safe driving.

Our hotel in Athens was the Grande Bretagne Athens, situated in the heart of the city on Constitution Square, diagonally adjacent to the Greek Parliament (notable for its hourly Changing of the Guard. The hotel is an old-world gem with high-ceilinged rooms and efficient and friendly staff. The concierge staff was especially helpful.

During our five-night stay, we benefitted tremendously by having booked three private three-hour tours offered by Context Travel; we've now also used them in Dublin, Istanbul, Paris and Rome and they are simply, hands down, the very best! We toured the Acropolis, Parthenon and Acropolis Museum on our first day of touring; the National Archaeological Museum of Athens on the second; and the Ancient Agora with Plaka Neighborhood on the third. Just outstanding tours led by by totally knowledgeable and super friendly tour guides. Words to the wise: Wear very comfortable shoes and always carry water with you.

Lastly our meals: Starting every day with an expansive breakfast buffet at our hotel's Rooftop Restaurant energized our tours of the city. We enjoyed two delicious dining experiences at this same restaurant looking out at the picture-postcard-perfect lit-up Acropolis. Another evening we dined at Tudor Hall in the Grand Bretagne's adjacent sister hotel, the King George; a very elegant, impeccably served and rather pricey restaurant, but a tad more fancy than appetite-satisfying. Cookoovaya was perhaps a more trendy eatery, a little off the beaten path, but with delicious menu, very ample servings and reasonably priced. On our final night in Athens, we were able to get in (reservations way in advance recommended) to Dionysos Zonar's; outdoor dining with a perfect view of the nearby lit-up Parthenon made for a most memorable evening!

During our entire stay in Athens, we felt appreciated, safe and very welcome.
It's a wonderful city with a truly amazing history and so very, very much to offer!

title: AMAZING MUST-DO TOUR !!!!
body:
Our group of 4 loved this tour! We did a city tour afterward and it felt so boring in comparison. This one was fun, interesting, unique, and full of cool stories. If you're visiting Kensington/Chinatown, you have to do this - without it, you'd miss the deep history and meaning behind what you're seeing. You would miss out on a lot.. Kieran gave us a deeper appreciation for the area - the beautiful art (!!) , the history, and the stories behind the buildings and people.

Kieran was a FANTASTIC guide - friendly, funny, welcoming, and a great speaker & storyteller. He shared so many meaningful stories and fun facts. We loved it! Made the tour so interesting and fun!

One thing to note: the tour says 3 hours, but if your group is small, it might be shorter. That didn’t bother us at all - we care more about quality than the exact length. It still felt full and complete.

The pace was great too. I liked that it wasn’t rushed and had a good balance of walking, listening, and a little resting. I also loved the coffee shop Kieran took us to—it was quirky, fun, and sparked some conversation and laughs… (but I won't give away the details!)

This tour is more for people who enjoy something unique, fun..... especially if you appreciate diverse cultures, local history, and understanding how a neighborhood came to be the way it is. It’s not your average city tour, and that’s what makes it so special and fun.

Overall, a beautiful, memorable experience!

title: A unique trip to Teotihuacan from Mexico City
body:
Went on May 9th to see Teotihuacan, and I happened to be the only guest attending the tour! The trip was super interesting and unconventional, we started by using public transport to go from the city center to a bus hub and then took an overland bus to go straight to the ruins - including some introduction to the surrounding area and vendors / musicians live on the bus :D.
Arriving at Teotihuacan it definitely pays to have a knowledgeable guide and I learned a whole lot about the history and culture of the place, including opportunities to look at some in-depth archeology in the attached museum. Notably, we also visited a local shop with produce and the obsidian crafts that played a role in the history of this area. The trip ends with homemade Mexican food at a local home, which was very yummy!
My tour guide was super friendly and communicative both in English and Spanish and clearly well informed about Teotihuacan as well as every place along the way!
We went back on the bus and I returned to my place with no issues. Would definitely recommend the tour for anybody looking to see Teotihuacan based in Mexico City, this is the coolest way to do it!

title: A great way to settle into Boston!
body:
We had such a great time spending the day with Bob (& Caitlyn) walking, talking and eating our way around Boston’s North end, Freedom Trail and Beacon Hill.

As our first introduction to the city, Bob gave us a wonderful overview of the sights and history while we enjoyed some delicious food and good company. He is incredibly knowledgeable and personable, and dedicated to ensuring your time in Boston (well beyond the tour) is fully enjoyed.

The small size of the group was appreciated as we could enjoy hidden gems and more intimate settings. We were so glad we were not part of the giant tour groups we passed, blasting their overly scripted info and waiting for all to keep up, while we briskly moved through the city enjoying one another's company.

Bob not only provided great information on the tour, but followed up sharing all we did and more, for reference.

We will definitely look for more Intrepid Tours as we travel.

**Wear comfy shoes. Bring water. This is a rigorous, albeit enjoyable, walk!

I took the Game of Thrones tour and my guide was Doris. I have only great things to say about the experience on this tour and Croatia. title: Excellent private walking tour and meal in Bucharest.
body: This private one on one Discover Bucharest Highlights and Food Tour was excellent. Made especially wonderful by our tour guide Elana (pronounced Ejuana). As a native Bucharest resident and highly educated double master student in history, she was extremely knowledgeable in this field and carried out this tour to perfection. The finishing touch was an excellent Romanian 3 course meal. I highly recommend this tour and hope you get Elana as your guide.

A great way to settle into Boston!
Aug 2025
We had such a great time spending the day with Bob (& Caitlyn) walking, talking and eating our way around Boston’s North end, Freedom Trail and Beacon Hill.

As our first introduction to the city, Bob gave us a wonderful overview of the sights and history while we enjoyed some delicious food and good company. He is incredibly knowledgeable and personable, and dedicated to ensuring your time in Boston (well beyond the tour) is fully enjoyed.

The small size of the group was appreciated as we could enjoy hidden gems and more intimate settings. We were so glad we were not part of the giant tour groups we passed, blasting their overly scripted info and waiting for all to keep up, while we briskly moved through the city enjoying one another's company.

Bob not only provided great information on the tour, but followed up sharing all we did and more, for reference.

We will definitely look for more Intrepid Tours as we travel.

**Wear comfy shoes. Bring water. This is a rigorous, albeit enjoyable, walk!

title: A fantastic experience, highly recommended!
body:
We had a brilliant time on our street food tour! Lena was an amazing guide, who shared her local knowledge and was more than happy to answer questions that we had.
The food we tried was delicious and gave us a real insight into different foods that we may not normally try, but would now happily eat again.
Our kids (14 and 16) also had a brilliant time and tried almost everything on offer!
Absolutely recommend!

title: Athens brought to life!
body:
We had a fantastic tour last Tuesday 15th September with Babis.

We thoroughly enjoyed learning/experiencing some of the old history, religious buildings, architecture, neighbourhoods and ruins of the city and experiencing the sights and smells of the many markets on offer. All brought to life by Babis, who’s knowledge was remarkable and really went the extra mile to show us more for his beautiful city.

It was also a great tour to do on our first day, to find our bearings and gain a geography of all the landmarks. A welcome coffee break was included halfway through on a rooftop cafe overlooking Monastiraki Square, with great views of the Acropolis - a very nice touch.

Thank you urban adventures and thank you Babis.

body: Wolfi was our guide for a 4+ hour walking and tram tour throughout Vienna. title: Fun and informative!
body:
We had a surprise private tour with Yoshi and had a wonderful time. We tried many yummy foods, both fish and otherwise.
Yoshi was very knowledgeable about Tokyo’s history and it was cool to learn about food, religion, and culture all on one tour. It was a very relaxed atmosphere and took place before the market got too crowded.
My favorite thing about this tour was that we were guided to places I would have never found on my own. I definitely would have not tried some of my favorite things I’ve had on this trip if not for this tour.

title: Great afternoon
body:
We hadn't been to these neighborhoods before and had an awesome afternoon learning more about Fitzroy and Collingwood . Our Guide Tristan was informative and it was obvious he loved the area, it's culture, art and music scene (and some pretty nifty short cuts ; ) It was so cool to be shown around by a local and getting inside tips on things that were going on like the cool markets with local artists work and great local souvenirs while getting to know about the area's past, present and future.
A great way to get planning your next visit to the area. Get into it!

title: Avoid this Bali "Eat Street" Local Food Tour .
body: This was the worst food tour I have ever been on. The meeting address was incorrect. The first restaurant was not open. The food was prepared in unsanitary conditions. There were no clean toilet facilities on the tour. We were required to take a taxi from location to location 2 times during the tour. The restaurant for roast suckling pig was dirty, noisy, disgusting, and dirty. Overall a terrible experience. Intrepid should be embarrassed. Our guide was friendly and did his best although the overall tour was a disaster.

title: Great tour, highly recommend
body: Dave was our guide for we three couples from the US. He did a fantastic job in super hot and muggy weather. He kept us in the shade as much as possible. title: Outstanding tour and marvelous guide!
body: This tour is a must for visitors to Toronto. Our guide, Kieran, was outstanding. We have been on several private tours, but never had the delightful and engaging conversation we had with Kieran. His intelligence and dry sense of humor made the tour even more fun. The walking portion of the tour is short, but pleasant. You see green space along with interesting architecture. We heard many intriguing historical facts along with very tasting some fantastic treats! Each item we tried was delectable and it was difficult to find a favorite. The St. Lawrence Market is such a cool place to find fabulous food, a multitude of sweets and unique souvenirs. We will definitely visit the market on our next visit to the city.

title: A highlight of our trip
body: We had a great time on our tour with our guide, Theodoris. We highly recommend it for to enjoy the ambience of the city and the bustle of Athens at night. Theodoris was knowledgeable, fun and flexible. The restaurants we visited were fantastic with lots of atmosphere, and Theodoris offered information not only about the food but about the history and culture of the city. It was one of the highlights of our trip.

title: Fabulous tour, definitely recommend!
body:
This was a fantastic tour! We were in a small group of 6 people plus our guide Patrick, and we stopped at 4 delicious tasting spots. Patrick was great, gave us a lot of information and recommendations for places to eat/drink/visit.
The tour did an excellent job to accommodate a pescatarian and someone who didn’t eat pork (tricky in Austria).
This is a must, bring your appetites and enjoy!

title: 5 Stars
body: Our guide knew quite an impressive number of eateries away from the center—each was a little gem. He interspersed our eating with an interesting conversation about Viennese society. The personal private tours allowed us to linger where we wished and discuss any and all topics to our satisfaction. We finished the tour with our stomachs and minds full and happy. Highly recommended.

title: Fun night with Maria!
body: We had a great night with Maria! We went to 4 totally different places in Vienna. Really fun places with different atmospheres. Would highly recommend this if you are looking for something off the beaten path. Also, we needed to use the metro to get to some of the places. Maria showed us how to buy the tickets and when we were all going from place to place for the food tour, she also showed us how to use the metro for other places we were going the following day. It was really helpful and the metro was easy to use. Thanks Maria!!!

body:

Thank you and would definitely recommend.

title: Fantastic Day Adventure by Tuk tuk!
body: Three weeks ago I took the Intrepid Urban Adventures Bangkok “Old Bangkok Temples and Markets by Tuk-Tuk” tour. I was surprised to find that I was the only booking for the morning. I promptly met my wonderful guide Ait at the meeting point and he brought us to our tuktuk driver that shuttled us throughout the morning. Ait was a newer guide but I thought he was great! He spoke fair English and we had some interesting conversation about the area, the world and beyond. Wat Pho the Reclining Buddha and the Mont temple are a must see. We also got to see children practicing their instruments and traditional dance at the temple. We visited the flower market and he folded me a flower (pic). He even bought me an iced latte in the marketplace when I was sweating thru my shirt. If you are in Bangkok for a day or two, this is an enjoyable 4 hour tour. Thank you, Ait! Sawadi ka! ?????? ?? Susannah
full review:
Susannah S
Oakland, CA48 contributions
0

title: An experience not to be missed
body:
we booked the trip via Marriott Bonvoy app (lnked with viator/TA) - to get some points (that has yet to be received on our end), but anyway, it was truly the highlight of our holiday!
Guided by the ever so friendly and knowledgeable Ms Apple, we started the day in Maeklong train station - arrived in 8.30am to catch the 1st train there and back! we got to sit in a coffee shop beside the railway and got out to catch the train chugging beside us, what an experience. Next on to the coconut processing village - yummy coconuts! lastly, we went to Damnoensaduak Floating Market - also one unique experience, buying souvenirs on a boat! Finished the trip and back in Bangkok town by 2pm - time well spent!
Thanks a lot Ms Apple and Bangkok Urban Adventures!

Mina has a wealth of knowledge that he passes on with ease.
It also helps that he is super friendly.
The sites visited on the tour highlight the old and the modern Egypt.
The time in traveling from Cairo is well spent.
Highly recommend!

title: Like a night out with a friend who loves their city and wants you to experience all the things!
body: A highlight of my 3-week trip to Egypt! I did this walking towards the end of my trip when I moved hotels to downtown Cairo after staying near the pyramids. Marwa was a fantastic guide and gave loads of information about recent history, daily life, and her fond memories of downtown hijinks. She took time to learn my interests and pointed out places she thought I’d find particularly interesting, along with the itinerary highlights. As a solo female traveller I would not have ventured out downtown at night - this was a great way to have an evening out on the town :)

title: URBAN ADVENTURES THE WORST OF EGYPT
body: Lousy tour operator... they do not answer the only phone line they have, plus that line does not have whatsapp, not managing to coordinate the hotel pickup we approached the meeting point specified on the service voucher from 6:00 am to which many cars from different companies arrived, but Urban Adventures Jamas arrived. It was written to the email in view of not having a whatsapp line and not achieving communication and after 4 hours of waiting they reported that they did not have our reservation... in short we had to hire another company at 11:00 am to not lose the day because the next day we took another flight. Actually in Cairo we only stayed for 2 days and we were very sorry with this company that it is incredible that in the 21st century they do not operate a whatsapp line or have an emergency hotline or a chat on their page. Manejan schedules from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm when excursions run from 7:00 am.

Sales S
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience, and we're truly sorry to hear how disappointed you were with your tour in Cairo. We understand how frustrating it must have been to wait for a service that didn’t arrive, especially with limited time in the city and travel plans already in place. This is certainly not the experience we aim to provide, and we’re sorry for the inconvenience and stress this caused. Unfortunately, we've been unable to locate your booking or contact information based on the details in your review. If you're open to it, we’d really appreciate the opportunity to look into this further and understand what went wrong. You're welcome to reach out to us directly at customercare@intrepidtravel.com with your booking details, and our team will do our best to follow up promptly. Thank you again for your feedback, we genuinely value it, and we’re sorry that we let you down on this occasion.

title: Tasty treats, churches, and organ meats
body: The tour starts with the central market looking at small shops that sell meat/organs, herbal remedies, fruit, flowers, and prepared dishes. The fruit tasting was interesting, as you get a chance to taste fruits not available in the US. The old town is basically a few large churches, the president’s house, and other Catholic Church related buildings. The chocolate tasting was excellent in the variety and quality of chocolate. Overall, the guide was knowledgeable about an area that is somewhat interesting.

title: Great tour with a super nice guide
body: We accidentally got a private tour. We were the only once who signed up supposedly because of the heat. I am glad the guide still did the tour even with two attendees. The tour was great. We were greeted by our tourguide Andrea who met us with warm pretzels and water at the starting point. We did not bring any backpack or a bag, so she carried the water for us all the time. She was were nice. She started the tour by showing us some architectural gems and telling a bit about history of Bucharest. Then we first stopped at one local restaurant for a plate of Romanian food and beer. Thereafter we moved along too this huge local food market. There were a bit of que but i guess since she was a guide she skipped all the lines and the food and drinks were served quickly. She told us about some other places we shall visit and gaves us recommendations. The guide was talkative, so it was fun to ask her questions. Definitely recommend if you are looking to try some local cuisine and to get to know about local history. Keep in mind that it is a bit hot during summer, but it is possible to do the tour nevertheless and have a good time.

title: As local as it gets
body: Amazing afternoon with Mirjana! Started from the Riva (promenade) and made our way through busy streets of Split, squinchy yet easily navigable to the main sights! Admired to the stories of the past - Roman Emperors and did I mention the Sphynx?! Afterwards we swooped to the Green market within the walking distance and got ourselves local snacks, cheese, olives and grapes - worthy the nectar of gods! Highly recommendable for an easy Split immersion experience!

title: A different side to Hoi An
body:
Starting with a cute boat ride we arrived at the destination of our bike ride which took us through the villages and farm areas of Hoi An.

Our guide Nam was knowledgeable and informative and made us feel well looked after as we road past water buffalo’s, fish farms and market gardens, arriving at our dinner destination for a beautiful home cooked meal at a local Vietnamese restaurant using herbs and vegetables from the surrounding farms.
Our chef Thanh was entertaining and a master chef! Meal was delicious.

A fabulous afternoon spent enjoying a different side of Hoi An.

Highly recommend!

title: A glimpse into the past of a once mighty culture
body:
We (party of two) took part in the My Son Discovery (starting in Hoi An) Tour.
The early morning timing is important, as we were then ahead of the crowds, which might otherwise have diminished our good experience. Our Local UrbanAdventures Guide Nam Pham managed it really well, that we were mostly alone in the various sections of the site. This certainly added to our experience. His explanations and his background knowledge of the site was helpful for us to grasp at least a bit of the Champa culture.
We also enjoyed that he was relaxed enough to go to a local Mí Gà Restaurant on the way back, as we had missed out breakfast (due to the early start) and were hungry.
Thumbs up!

title: A taste of Brooklyn's homegrown experiences
body:

I recommend you take this tour eraly on in your trip so you can revisit all the places Alex recommended.

title: Catch the Collingwood vibe
body: Collingwood is an inner-city Melbourne suburb, which was immortalized as "Carringbush" in Frank Hardy's epic novel "Power Without Glory." Collingwood is no longer a down at heel extension of Melbourne, it's super trendy with coffee shops, eateries, craft breweries and art galleries. Collingwood is a good place to walk around, you can get the vibe that this suburb famous.

title: A delightful afternoon in Paris!
body: Due to airline scheduling issues, we found ourselves with a full day layover in Paris. Although short, our time in Paris was made memorable via a delightful afternoon with Vivienne as he lead us on a visit to the Latin Quarter (Pantheon, The Sorbonne, and the Cathedral of St Etienne du Mont) and St Germain ( Luxembourg Gardens, the Cathedral of St Sulpice....of DaVinci Code fame and last, but not least, Macrons at Pierre Herme) neighborhoods. Born and raised in Paris, Vivienne showed us Paris through the eyes of a local, combining history with culture as he talked about his city. Lastly, we finished our excursion with a fine selection of French cheeses and terrific wine at a local shop. By avoiding the standard tourist traps one might expect, we had the pleasure of experiencing Paris as if we lived there also. Well done Vivienne.
full review:

title: A Must Do!
body: Patricia was an amazing guide during this tapas tour of Madrid. She took us to wonderful “off the beaten path” places and introduced us to food and drink we would not have known to order ourselves. During the tastings and our walk between stops, Patricia told us stories of the history and culture of Madrid that really gave us an appreciation of this beautiful city. Our three young adult children (ages 18-23) and we agreed that this was one of our favorite experiences in our whole trip across Spain. Highly recommend!!!!

title: Excellent experience
body: Melbourne Urban Adventures Bites and Sights Tour is a definite “Bucket List” when visiting Melbourne. Even if you are a regular and trust me your knowledge and understanding of this beautiful City will be greater. The Eureka Skydeck sets the platform for an excellent tour. The Laneway visits along with the Markets make this a fascinating tour. As always the right ingredients make a polished meal. Tour guide Kellie was the key ?? to make this not only a brilliant tour but her likeable and personal touch put the icing on this well baked cake. Kellie is a widely travelled tour guide that not only knows Melbourne but she knows the world. A beautiful person with a soul to match. This group is lucky to have such a person like Kellie. Flexible and easy going too. I would and do recommend this tour to any person. Even if you think you know Melbourne (like I thought I did ) you will be amazed at some of the history and stories to be told. Don’t hesitate to book a Tour with Urban. Integrity and professional is how I would label them Kellie is the best Tour guide ever encountered and have no hesitation in recommending her 101%. Cheers S

Excellent experience
Melbourne Urban Adventures Bites and Sights Tour is a definite “Bucket List” when visiting Melbourne. Even if you are a regular and trust me your knowledge and understanding of this beautiful City will be greater. The Eureka Skydeck sets the platform for an excellent tour. The Laneway visits along with the Markets make this a fascinating tour. As always the right ingredients make a polished meal. Tour guide Kellie was the key ?? to make this not only a brilliant tour but her likeable and personal touch put the icing on this well baked cake. Kellie is a widely travelled tour guide that not only knows Melbourne but she knows the world. A beautiful person with a soul to match. This group is lucky to have such a person like Kellie. Flexible and easy going too. I would and do recommend this tour to any person. Even if you think you know Melbourne (like I thought I did ) you will be amazed at some of the history and stories to be told. Don’t hesitate to book a Tour with Urban. Integrity and professional is how I would label them Kellie is the best Tour guide ever encountered and have no hesitation in recommending her 101%. Cheers S

title: Great for locals and tourists alike.
body: My partner and I were lucky enough to have Anna as our guide. I have lived near Melbourne all my life and my partner has just immigrated here from Europe, we don't know Melbourne so well, so this was a perfect opportunity to learn a little more. We immediately got along well with Anna and found we had a lot in common, the tour ended up feeling like more of a catch up with an old friend. Anna showed us places that we may not have discovered on our own, over lovely drinks and conversation. I highly recommend this tour, and also Anna as a guide. Thank you so much.

title: From Souk to Stove: The Best Tagine in Morocco!
body:
The Marrakech Tour - Tagine Cooking Class was easily one of the best experiences of our trip. Our host guided us through the vibrant souks to gather fresh ingredients, and visiting the butcher—with live chickens in the back—was a real, authentic glimpse into daily Moroccan life.

After shopping, we were welcomed into a stunning Riad where the cooking began. We prepared a Moroccan tomato salad, zalouk, and a chicken tagine. After two weeks of tagines across Morocco, I can confidently say this was the best one we had—and not just because I made it!

The recipes were provided at the end, and we’ve already recreated the meal at home. It instantly transported us back to the smells, tastes, and atmosphere of Marrakech.

Highly recommend this class for anyone looking to take home more than just souvenirs—this is a memory you can relive with every bite.

title: Memphis & Saqqara - highly recommended as a starting point to see Egypt
body: My Wife & I went on this tour of Memphis & Saqqara and ended up being the only ones booked, so we essentially had a private tour. Our tour guide, Mina, was excellent! His passion and knowledge for all things Egypt was exceptional and he was always willing to help and answer questions. Memphis was great, seeing the Step Pyramid of Djoser at Saqqara was quite surreal and then going into the Pyramid of Unas had some real wow moments. Thankyou Mina for being such a fantastic guide and person. We'll treasure this tour for a long time.

title: We Learned to Love Cairo with Mina
body: Our fascinating walk over the Nile into downtown Cairo with Mina was a treat as he enthusiastically shared his love and deep knowledge of his vibrant city, its rich history, interesting culture and architecture, and beauty. Along the way we were taken to some of his favourite quarters, places where locals were gathering with friends in cafés and restaurants and where we were treated to some of the culinary flavours of Egypt. This walk with Mina really helped us to understand and appreciate the amazing city that Cairo is. By the end of our evening, we felt like we were saying farewell to a good friend.

title: Beautiful bike tour along the Lima coast
body:
Highly recommended tour
Super choice of route: beautiful views along the coast and exploring the colorful and artistic district of Baranco

Excellent guide: great explanations
Tito our guide gave us with his extensive knowledge of the geology, faces, architecture and culture of the city
I'm impressed.

The speed of the tour was well adapted to us and we were able to make sufficient breaks (for photo stops, closer visit of Baranco and for resting or explanations)
The bikes were in top condition we felt safe throughout. Tito always drove ahead and got us through traffic safely and well.

title: Wonderful walking tour in Lima
body: We, my husband, me and two friends, booked a walking tour with Urban Adventures for an afternoon walking tour on our one day in Lima. Our guide was Paula, and she was wonderful, very knowledgeable, funny and personable. Her English was great, and she did not only show us interesting sites in the city, including a wonderful market, she also took us on the bus tot the center of the city, and talked about the Peruvian culture, politics etc. It was a wonderful way to learn much about Lima and Peru in a short time, and from a wonderful warm and funny person like Paula.

title: Such an incredible and personal experience with our guide Mihaela!
body:
Mihaela was the most incredible guide!! It was just two of us and we both felt we connected with her as a friend! She offered wonderful personal experiences and context to the historical facts of the places we visited, so we experienced Bucharest through her. She made the tour personable for us, and we had an amazing lunch of sarmale, m?m?lig?, and papana?i for desert! Could not recommend this tour or our wonderful guide Mihaela more.

July was a hot time to go, but we took lots of breaks. Water and a snack (and lunch obviously) is included in the tour, so you’ll be all set!

title: Insightful and Well Organized Food Tour with Elena
body:
We had a very enjoyable time on this food tour. The communication leading up to the tour was excellent. They reached out beforehand to introduce our guide and even sent a photo so we knew who to look for. That extra care made a big difference.

Elena, our guide, was outstanding. She was knowledgeable and passionate, offering great insights into the local history as well as the food. We learned a lot and felt truly immersed in the experience.

The food was delicious and the stops were thoughtfully selected. While the tour felt a bit pricey compared to other food tours at a similar price point, I still found it well worth it for the quality of the guide and the organization.

Overall, I would recommend this tour, especially if you value clear communication and a guide who brings the city’s culture to life.

title: This tour made me want to come back to see more!
body: At a friend's suggestion, I took the "Beautiful Decay and Alternative" tour, and I'm so glad I did. I was only in Bucharest for a few days on business and had a single day to look around and get to know the city a little. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I had a great time. My guide, Ioana, was fantastic. The tour took in loads of incredible buildings, from houses to museums, that are in various states of decay but also in various stages of repair and renovation. Each one has a story which Ioana conveyed with knowledge and passion, and we even had special permission to enter a number of them. This was followed by a tour of some amazing street art, which I absoutely loved. We even got to go inside the university and see some incredibe murals by student artists. I got to see a vibrant, creative side of Bucharest which I would otherwise never have been aware of. The tour made me want to visit the city again and get to know it better. If I do, I'll definitely take another one of these tours (maybe the coffee tour Ioana said was in the pipeline!).

title: A taste of rural Vietnam by bike.
body: Bong took this tour for my wife and I. Her attention to our safety was paramount. The boat trip was enjoyable as was the rural bike ride which was not at all strenuous. The evening meal was preceded by a tour of the gardens where the much of the food was sourced. It was a delicious four course meal. Bong was very knowledgeable and willing to share. It is a thoroughly worthwhile experience!

title: History and cuisine on point
body:
Our guide picked us up on time and as agreed at the National Theater.
The guide spoke fluent English and gave us a lively introduction to the history of San Jose and Costa Rica.

We were in remote places and parks, and he had a lot to tell us about them.
In the middle of the tour there was a short stop with a coffee of your choice and a traditional tortilla.

The subsequent detour to the central market was also very informative and absolutely fantastic in terms of food.
We tried various fruits and a kind of sorbet with cinnamon.

It was great that we had booked our tour as a public tour.
As "JOHN" didn't show up, we were alone with our guide.

All in all, a worthwhile tour.
full review:

title: Funny, informative and tasty tour with a guide that will help you through your trip!
body:
We did this tour with Brian as our guide. Brian was funny and informative and clearly knows his stuff about New York food. We tried different food local food places we would never have tried without the tour so really worth doing.
Brian was also extremely helpful with recommendations for any and all cuisines in New York, not just during our tour but also via email at any point during our trip which was extremely appreciated.
Would 100% recommend for anyone that wants to try food you wouldn't think of trying as a tourist. Thanks Brian!

title: Great food tastes and excellent guide
body:
We had a great tour with Wira. He took us through the local market and explained a number of things before going to the food stalls to taste some great local food.
We had already been in Bali for a while and we were able to taste things you don’t see on a lot of menus.
This tour is a great way to see another side of food in Bali and taste some delicious street food.
Wira was really good in his explanations and answering our questions about local foods.

title: Try to book with Jason - he’s the best!!
body: My daughter and I did the tour of St Lawrence market with Jason and agreed he was one of the very best tour guides we’ve ever had. Fun, funny, incredibly knowledgeable and chock full of terrific local stories, he made 3 delicious hours fly by! Among the tastings? Apple cake, bagels, blintzes, pierogis, Nanaimo bars, peameal bacon sandwich with maple mustard and more! We were stuffed by the end and knew so much more about Toronto. Highly recommend!!!!

title: Essential tour for a successful trip to Paris
body:
Absolutely wonderful, informative informal tour of Latin Quarter and St. Germain. Our tour guide Vivien, a true Parisien, not only educated us about the historical places on the tour, he pointed out sights where movies and tv shows were filmed in the area. We also appreciated Vivien's commentary putting the French, and particularly Parisien, culture and personality in historical perspective. My wife and I came away with a better understanding of who the French are. Finally, Vivien had some great insights into what cafe's and bakeries to avoid, who and when to tip, and other inside information that made the rest of our trip a success.

If possible, do the tour on your first day in Paris. Vivien's inside info was essential for the success of the rest of our trip.

title: Good but wrong description - this is NOT a food tour
body: The tour itself was good, but singularly there would be 5 stars - if you knew what to expect and consciously paid for it. Unfortunately it had nothing to do with the title "Wine, cheese and pastries in the Marais" but was completely free of food and drinks except for a mini-sweet pastry. Very unfortunate, as we had booked the tour especially as a "wine-cheese-food tour". The title and description of the tour are therefore urgently to be updated. I am trying to get a refund from the organizer.

Sales S
Hi Robert, Thank you for your recent review. We are sorry to learn of your disappointment in the tour you purchased for you time in Paris. We have looked at your complaint and are quite sure that while you may have intended to purchase a wine tour, that in actuality you did purchase the https://www.viator.com/tours/Paris/Hidden-Paris-Discover-Medieval-Marais-on-a-Walking-Tour/d479-5944P3 which is inclusive of a local English speaking guide and a croissant. When looking at wine and cheese tours there is nothing listed that coincides with the price range of your ticketing. We do believe this to have been an error perhaps in selecting the tour you intended, and the one that you booked. We do believe that the tour you purchase is what was delivered, and therefore will not be providing a refund to you at this time. We are happy to provide to you a 10% Future Booking Voucher as a gesture of goodwill, and we do hope that you managed to enjoy your time in Paris. With thanks, Michelle

title: Awesome Experience!
body: Our guide Brahim met us and we were lucky enough to be the only 2 on the tour so had a private guide! He was very chatty with good English and explained some of the history of Marrakesh as well as the traditions and origins of the foods we tried and sharing some recipes. There was loads to eat and we were glad we arrived hungry, we also enjoyed some traditional mint tea. We both really enjoyed the experience and would definitely recommend this, by going on the second day of our trip we got some top tips on what to try during the rest of our trip, we also got advice on how to haggle in the souks and the best / safest ways to navigate the footpaths and roads.

title: Best tour to get to know Marrakech
body: I had a tour with Mo. He is the best tour guide you can image. We walked to historical places and he very well explained the history behind every single monument. We visited the museum of photography, the palace of Bahia, Saadian tombs. Then we visited the famous bakery where locals bake their bread and the hammam over (Farran) where locals leave their tangia to be made. The highlight of the tour was visiting the places where they cook Méchoui (upon my request)! He is super nice and I highly recommend him to all my friends who want to visit and have a nice time in Marrakech.

Best tour to get to know Marrakech

I had a tour with Mo. He is the best tour guide you can image. We walked to historical places and he very well explained the history behind every single monument. We visited the museum of photography, the palace of Bahia, Saadian tombs. Then we visited the famous bakery where locals bake their bread and the hammam over (Farran) where locals leave their tangia to be made. The highlight of the tour was visiting the places where they cook Méchoui (upon my request)! He is super nice and I highly recommend him to all my friends who want to visit and have a nice time in Marrakech.
Read more

title: First time Cooking Class
body: I booked this experience for me and my friend for my birthday. Laila was such a great chef/host. We walked to the market, which was a bit of a trek so bring some walking shoes, if it was a bit shorter, I’d give this 5 stars. Though it was cool to see all the stores along the way to getting our ingredients for dinner. Once we made it back the riad, which is STUNNING by the way, we were given time to rest with tea and biscuits. Then we go to work. This was such a fun and interactive experience. Laila is very helpful, patient, and funny! We made chicken tagine, baba ghanoush, Moroccan salad, and bread! It was all so delicious and highly recommend.

title: Authentic Thai experience
body:
Excellent informative trip. We spent the morning with Nai , our guide and Manit our driver. Was picked up at the hotel as we were the only people on the trip. Nai was super friendly and we spent the trip to MaeKhlong exchanging stories nuggets our cultures and where to find good food in Bangkok.

At MaeKhlong, Nai brought us to sample the local Thai fare ( mainly sweet desserts) and a look into a traditional Thai Market.

We also visited a family run coconut sugar farm. (Look out for the super cute and friendly family dog - Fifa)

Explored an authentic floating market and more than ample time to explore the market ourselves and sample the local fare.

Manjit was instrumental in us reaching our destinations on time (especially to watch the train pass by the market). An excellent safe and experienced driver. Vehicle was clean and comfortable.

Would definitely recommend this trip. Learnt and experience Thai life outside of Bangkok
full review:
Alyxandria L

title: Cu Chi Tunnels visit
body:
Cu Chi Tunnels – Intense but unforgettable.
A powerful glimpse into Vietnam’s war history. Crawling through the tunnels gives you a real sense of the resilience and struggle. Go early to beat the crowds — and if you can, go with a guide like Thanh. His tips and clear explanations really brought the place to life.

title: Must-do tour to see all the best sites of Istanbul with a great guide
body: Fabulous day with Berivan in Istanbul! She was so knowledgeable and passionate about her city that it was a joy to learn from her. Loved seeing key sites like Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. She spent extra time with us to ensure we saw the Grand Bazar and Spice Bazar, along with a memorable ice cream experience and coffee fortune telling. Highly recommend this experience for an intro to Istanbul.

title: A life of an Egyptian...
body: Our Tour guide Mina was an awesome guide. He is a friendly, energetic and mainly he listens and understands you. As we walked, he explained to us all the different events that took place in the different routes/areas of Cairo. His has a wealth of knowledge not only of Egypt but in his endeavors globally. Speaking to Mina and getting his response from the heart meant a lot then from someone reading from a manual. We walked through the streets of Cairo downtown, seeing from the heritage structures, enjoying local cuisine, shops and people while still getting an understanding of all amneties. We also experienced the subway and enjoyable experience. Even something like simply crossing a road. Mina made us feel comfortable from start to end. I highly recommend Mina, wishing him all the best in his endeavors.

body: This was a really interesting tour and certainly worthwhile doing if you don't mind a decent walk. title: Perfect activity for travelers new to San Jose/Costa Rica
body:
Very Highly recommended
We had an evening to kill in San Jose between our flight landing in the afternoon and heading off to central valley the following morning. We are a family of 4 that includes 17 and 21 year old children.
Daniel was our guide and the experience was a perfect way to fill that evening. He was very interesting to listen to and taught us a lot of about CR culture and history. The evening was capped by the best food we had in CR.
Note - you only eat at the very end of the tour so don't start out hungry!

title: New York Foodie meets North End
body: We had Alison as our guide for our group (4 total). I went with my 7 year old son and we had SUCH a great time! It was one of the personal highlights of my trip to Boston. As a foodie, and a New Yorker, I am spoiled with great food. The experience we had was awesome. We went to non-touristy places, and even one tucked away down an alley -the kind of place where you'd have to be in the know to go. Though my son is also a foodie, he gets restless at times, but Alison (having 3 kids of her own) handled him with such grace and patience, and kept him engaged with I-spy when he had his "kid moments", as well as addressed his plethora of questions along the way. I was so happy with the quality of the food, the information related to the history of the significant points of interest along our route, the pace, and the pleasure of having Alison as our guide. I would wholeheartedly recommend this tour to anyone who has high food expectations and are looking to make a connection between what they eat, and the stories behind them.
full review:

title: Amazing Food, Great Guide, Unforgettable Experience
body: We had an incredible time on our New Orleans food tour with Kaffey! The food was absolutely fantastic — from local staples to hidden gems, every stop was delicious and thoughtfully chosen. Kaffey was an amazing guide — knowledgeable, friendly, and super accommodating. We had a vegetarian in our group, and she was able to enjoy every stop thanks to the great alternative options Kaffey arranged. Beyond the food, Kaffey shared so much local insight and gave us wonderful recommendations for the rest of our trip. It was the perfect way to experience the flavors and vibe of New Orleans. Highly recommend!

title: Always more to see and enjoy in Paris
body:
We'd chosen the tour as an intro to Paris for my inlaws, who were visiting for the first time. The weather gods were not kind and it was very cold and drizzly to begin with our lovely guide Vivien, with our agreement, shook thinks up a bit and we toured from beautiful church to beautiful church rather than followed the prescribed itinerary.

As a Parisien himself Vivien was a font of knowledge, amusing and great company on our explorations. Seeing the olds were flagging he tailored the tour to suit and we ended with a lovely charcuterie plate and wine under heaters sheltering from the chill.

I think the description is inaccurate as it is more a walking tour with a few snacks at the end, however ignoring the misnomer it was an enjoyable and informative tour, for both newbies and old friends of Paris. Vivien gets 5 stars, the mislabeling of the tour brings it down to 4.
full review:
Arigato Gato

title: Great food tour of Athens
body: We met our tour guide, Charlotte Mich, near the main markets of Athens and she took us through the meat and fish areas as well as the antiquities area and streets with spices, oils and herbs. There was so much to see and she was really informative and engaging in all we saw. We also went to areas to eat that a tourist would not necessarily go to and had the most delicious Meze and ouzo not to mention tasting different oils and olives in specialist shops. We both really enjoyed our tour and I loved seeing how different the way of life and shopping is in Athens compared to our own. Would highly recommend this tour just please make sure that you do not eat first!!

title: Religious Casablanca
body:
We got to explore the spiritual tour with Hicham. He is VERY knowledgeable and knew every detail of each museum we visited. He took great pictures of us at Hassan II Mosque and waited patiently as we took pictures/videos. Because we are Jewish he was able to get us into Beth-El and the oldest synagogue in Casablanca. He checked in on us several times and very easy to get along with!

There was one part of the experience that was not as good but it was not the fault of Hicham so we didn’t take any stars away from that. Toward the beginning we waited for the taxi driver to pick us up, but he was late. This created problems for Hicham as he made several calls to him and had an argument with another person that wanted to set us up with one of his taxis. Once the taxi driver picked us up (he has a contract with agency) he “appeared” very upset and would not let it go for most of our drive to and from other places. I mention appeared because I’m not sure if this was just his personality but based on the back and forth that happened it didn’t seem so.

Everything went very well with Hicham but the driver did not add well to the experience. As mentioned we did not want to take away stars since this was not Hichams fault.

title: Real Local Experience
body:
I came across this tour after a recommendation from a fellow traveller and I was thoroughly surprised on an area of the city I haven't yet come across in the time I have been in Bangkok.
A much more relaxing way to explore the city on a traditional longtail boat, which is owned by a local, and with the help of the guide, they shared their own stories which helped to provide a real local experience. After the boat, we were taken to the enchanting Grand Palace and learnt more about the Buddhism.
As a solo traveler, I really enjoyed seeing an alternative area of the city, away from all the crowds, with real local people.

title: Highly recommend!!
body:

The railway market was really impressive and you do need to see it to believe it!
Loved the coconut farm where you get to meet the owner and see the whole process of making coconut sugar. The owner seemed proud and happy to be welcoming tourists
The floating market is one of a kind and captures the early days of trading over water
Overall really enjoyed this tour. Couldn't have ask for more from Pokémon and Urban Adventures ??

title: A Great Tour of Hanoi
body: We enjoyed our tour of the city of Hanoi with our knowledgeable guide, An. It was great having a driver who got us safely through each location. We started with the Temple of Literature which was built in honor of Confucius in 1970. It became a University accepting students from the aristocracy society in 1076. We continued our tour visiting a traditional tea house where we heard about the importance of tea to the Vietnam Culture. We had delicious Lotus Flower Tea with traditional Green Bean Cake. We stopped at the infamous “Hanoi Hilton “. This place holds a dark place in history first as prison used by the French to imprison Vietnamese people and later used by the Vietnam soldiers to imprison American Prisoners of War. We then visited the beautiful Ngoc Son Temple located at the beautiful Hoan Kiem Lake. Our guide, An made this experience even more special by sharing stories and traditions from that era. stopped at Pho Thin a local lunch spot for some delicious Pho, Chinese donuts, and ice tea. We finished our tour visiting the impressive St. Joseph Cathedral which had a French Style Gothic Architecture. We can not say enough how much we enjoyed the tour and our personable and professional guide, An.
full review:
cflippen
Roanoke, VA335 contributions

A Great Tour of Hanoi
We enjoyed our tour of the city of Hanoi with our knowledgeable guide, An. It was great having a driver who got us safely through each location. We started with the Temple of Literature which was built in honor of Confucius in 1970. It became a University accepting students from the aristocracy society in 1076. We continued our tour visiting a traditional tea house where we heard about the importance of tea to the Vietnam Culture. We had delicious Lotus Flower Tea with traditional Green Bean Cake. We stopped at the infamous “Hanoi Hilton “. This place holds a dark place in history first as prison used by the French to imprison Vietnamese people and later used by the Vietnam soldiers to imprison American Prisoners of War. We then visited the beautiful Ngoc Son Temple located at the beautiful Hoan Kiem Lake. Our guide, An made this experience even more special by sharing stories and traditions from that era. stopped at Pho Thin a local lunch spot for some delicious Pho, Chinese donuts, and ice tea. We finished our tour visiting the impressive St. Joseph Cathedral which had a French Style Gothic Architecture. We can not say enough how much we enjoyed the tour and our personable and professional guide, An.

title: The yummiest of pisco

title: Not a private cycling experience - misleading.
body:
Sadly this was very disappointing, as much as I love to support local businesses. We booked and paid for a Private Coast Cycling Experience to start at 9am, instead we got 6 people on our tour leaving around 10am (no apology, no explanation, no refund).
We do private cycling tours all over the world: that way the guides can customise the ride according to our fitness and enjoyment level (always been successful). Today was not enjoyable and it was clear the guide just wanted to get this tour over and done with. Feel a bit ripped off, plus the fact that I felt embarrassed lagging behind (reason a nearly 60 year old lady booked a private tour and not to race with lovely 30-year olds - felt guilty keeping them up). If you want cheap group tours then yes it’s for you (nothing wrong with it, I was there too once). However if you want a private cycling tour look elsewhere.
full review:
Liz
Brisbane, Australia141 contributions

title: A Delicious, Fun & Personalised Tour with Reetika!
body: Reetika was an excellent tour guide, full of stories and the tour felt care-free with her. We stopped off at 5 different savoury spots and 2 different sweet spots, all around the area in Delhi where the local university students go. She tailored the food to our spice needs, so the food provided felt personalised. The walking tour took us to the local temple and around the streets of the local shops and market stalls. Reetika was particularly considerate about pushing us to try the Delhi Metro, which was surprisingly easy and stress-free for a couple of Londoners! What a great tour and thank you again Reetika for your kindness and a great tour!

title: Fantastic Chicago Food Tour with Rich
body:
I had such a great time on this food tour today! Rich was a fantastic guide—friendly, knowledgeable, and so welcoming from the start. The group was small and intimate, which made it easy to chat and enjoy the experience together.

We stopped at some amazing local spots, including Lou Malnati’s for deep-dish pizza, a classic steak sandwich place, and a fun hot dog stop. I’m vegetarian, and Rich made sure I was catered to at every stop, which I really appreciated!

The tour was a great mix of delicious food, Chicago history, and fun conversation. I’d definitely recommend it to anyone wanting a more personal and authentic food tour experience in the city!

title: Interesting history and tasty food samples
body: Our guide Jessie was wonderful. A very good storyteller, full of interesting bits of history. Nice balance of serious facts and humor and fun trivia. The 4 foods we sampled were all tasty, but on the smaller side. Think of it more as a tasting tour and not a meal replacement. Don't worry, you're not left hungry! But these are smaller "try it" samples. Love that they prioritize immigrant businesses, both old and newer. We had some excellent fried pork dumplings, two kinds of italian cheese, a part of a potato knish, and a chocolate rugelach. And you end at Essex Market, so lots of options to buy interesting things if you're wanting to sample even more foods on your own.
full review:

title: Outstanding tour of Melbourne with a personal touch
body: I can't recommend the tour highly enough to anyone visiting Melbourne. Lucas was a fantastic host and was very knowledgable. He made everybody in the group feel welcome. It felt more like exploring the city with friends than being on a normal tour. Together, we had lots of chats and laughs. The tour gave us a wonderful oversight of Melbourne. Despite not being good with heights, I enjoyed getting a view of Melbourne from the Skydeck. Afterwards we explored all that Melbourne has to offer, including the laneways and markets, and got to taste some of Melbourne's famous coffee and food. I would not want to have missed the tour!!!!

title: Exceptional Casablanca tour with Hicham Bennis
body: Morocco was on my must see list. I booked a private tour with Urban Adventures by Intrepid. I arrived an hour earlier than expected and Hicham came and greeted me right away. He was very professional and yet was like a friend taking us around. I had a remarkable day. If you are a photographer, you will appreciate his eye for getting the right angle. He stopped multiple times for us to take photos, and even took some photos for us. A highlight was picking out pastries and cookies and then going to a cafe to drink mint tea and eat our treasures. It was so good to learn the history of the city and architecture. We learned so much, and the time went quickly. I wholeheartedly recommend Urban Adventures Morocco. If you are doing a private tour, ask for Hicham. You will be so glad you did!

title: Marrakesh - Where History Meets Bohemia
body: Our wonderful guide Mounir, was inedible insightful and fun to be around. He was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about Marrakesh where he was born and bred. My daughter and I were eager listeners and came with many questions all which Mounir had answers too. We enjoyed our time with Mounir very much. He extended the tour by two hours out of kindness and because we were so keen to learn and see more. The Bahia palace was a special treat not least because Mounir managed to navigate the crowds so it appeared we had most of the palace to ourselves most of the time. A trip to the Hammam engine, below ground, was another highlight. Playing music with a local musician also a fantastic experience. Highly recommend this tour. Ask for Mounir

title: Great tour and really fun yet informative
body: This was a really unique and fun tour with a great guide Apple. The decision to avoid the Grand Palace and bring us to other temples was great. We avoided big crowds and saw a lot. The small tour size and getting around in Tuk Tuks meant we covered good distances and saw a lot. Apple was really knowledgeable, very friendly and helpful and we moved at our pace. title: Amazing Hanoi foodtour
body: I recently took part in a 3-hour food tour organized by HaNoi Urban Adventures. The tour featured a selection of local specialties, including banh my, bun cha, and banh cuon, which were all expertly prepared and presented. We finished the tour with a delicious egg coffee near Hoan Kiem Lake. Our tour guide, Nguyen Nguyen, provided excellent commentary and was very friendly and accommodating throughout the tour.

title: Thank you Mina! This Cairo Downtown guide was awesome!
body:
Our downtown Cairo tour with Mina was absolutely fantastic! Mina is an outgoing and friendly guide! He was informative, and enjoyable to be with. He showed us some special secret sites of the city… And even made accommodations for us to see some of the things that we wanted to see. He took us to popular patisserie for ice cream and a really good place for dinner for Shawarma! Yummy! He then took us on a metro to see another part of downtown Cairo, and also made sure that we were safe to our final destination back to the hotel. If you have a chance you should get Mina as your guide! He was cognizant of what we wanted to
see as well as flexible and accommodating ! Thank you Mina for a great evening on our last night in Cairo!

title: Great chance to sneak out from business and meet Lima
body:
Our guide Gladys shared both history and stories from today about Lima and Peru. A great chance to explore local food and drinks, plenty of opportunities to ask questions! And Convento San Francisco in the end was marvellous!
Only improvement opportunities I found is that the guide should wear the Urban Adventure sweatshirt, to make the identification easier at meeting point.

title: Excellent street art tour of Bucharest
body: As a big fan of murals and street art, tracking them in every new city I visit has become a hobby of mine. One of the most efficient ways to find them, especially in Bucharest, where many of the murals are rather hidden, is via a tour. Ioana was an excellent guide for this purpose: highly knowledgeable about the local street art scene, architecture and history. I really enjoyed walking around the center of the city and getting a clearer sense of its vibe. Thanks to Urban Adventures and Ioana for letting me see Bucharest through new eyes.

title: Hi an Boat & Bike With Sunset BBQ
body:
This was great it was a 10k bike ride being in our 60,s i thought it might bee too much but it is all on flat ground and was no trouble at all.
Our tour guide Nam Pham was great he looked after us all the way, riding through the rice fields and all the back lanes we could really see how others lived. We arrived on the boat where the captain cooked the BBQ as we were travelling along the river. The food was great. This is a must do for any age.

title: My Son - thoroughly recommended!
body: A fantastic 5 hour excursion to My Son. The journey itself is very interesting as you get to see life outside the tourist centre of Hoi An. Our guide, Nampham, brought My Son to life with over two hours viewing and describing the site. We arrived by 8.30am before the tourist hordes arrived and pretty much had the place to ourselves. Sadly you can see where the American bombs and bullets destroyed the ancient sites. Nampham made a lot of effort and helped us understand a lot more about the temples than we had read about in our guide book. Go there!
full review:
johnwjroome
London, UK35 contributions
1
My Son - thoroughly recommended!
A fantastic 5 hour excursion to My Son. The journey itself is very interesting as you get to see life outside the tourist centre of Hoi An. Our guide, Nampham, brought My Son to life with over two hours viewing and describing the site. We arrived by 8.30am before the tourist hordes arrived and pretty much had the place to ourselves. Sadly you can see where the American bombs and bullets destroyed the ancient sites. Nampham made a lot of effort and helped us understand a lot more about the temples than we had read about in our guide book. Go there!

title: 'Sunny' was a fabulous guide
body: The Gandhi's Delhi tour was very informative and well worth doing if you have some time in Delhi. Ask for Sunny as your guide on this tour or any of the many tours provided by Urban Adventurers. Sunny demonstrated a comprehensive knowledge of Gandhi’s life but also modern India which was fascinating, and his excellent English was literally the best that I heard from any guide during my time in India. He anticipated my preferences expertly and provided a tour which aligned perfectly my interests Nothing was too much trouble. I could not recommend Sunny more highly as a guide for his knowledge, professionalism and generosity of spirit.

title: Not really worth the money!
body: The guide, Jacinto, was very friendly and knowledgeable and responded to us as individuals (there were only two of us on this tour). The excursion, however, finished two hours early: the 'dining experience' was in reality a bowl of Pozele served to us in a kitchen with just ourselves and Jacinto. Not very satisfactory at all and certainly not living up to the description (or other food based 'Urban Adventures' I have done in other parts of the world). Teotihuacun, however, was truly impressive and having Jacinto with us made for an 'easier' trip than navigating our own way on public transport. Visit could perhaps have included some time at the Museo at the pyramid site (but, I am sure, had this been mentioned, Jacinto would have incorporated it into the programme). The "local dinner" was the real con!
