title: Adriana gave a memorable tour!
body: Adriana was the perfect host for our food tour of Mexico City. We arrived for the tour a bit early to get some uncrowded photos of our family in the Zocalo, and met up with Adriana at tour time. After introducing the group of 10 participants, we took a short walk to a local market where we were treated to a delicious breakfast of tamales and a traditional Mexican chocolate drink. There were three in our family, so we ordered one of each variety and got to sample all of them. (Our favorites were the mole and the verde!) We then walked back to the Zocalo, learning some history about the City and its inhabitants along the way. Adriana gave us all a quick lesson on how to use the Mexico City subway, and we were off on a quick ride out to a huge local market. (Pro tip – the subway doors only stay open for 5 seconds at each stop!) The market was amazing, with anything and everything you would ever need for a life in the city. We were able to taste several fantastic foods, including concentrated mole, fresh jimaca with chili powder, and some wonderful Oxacan cheese, to name a few. Adriana also helped us shop for the ingredients to make our own salsa, which was a highlight of the day as we had an entire restaurant to ourselves just outside the main market. Throughout the day, Adriana was full of energy and ready to answer all of our questions. Even our 10 year old was engaged the whole time! Thank you Adriana for a wonderful day and for sharing your passion with us.

title: Amazing morning in Athens
body:
I had an amazing morning in Athens. On this tour you will see Athens from a different and more local perspective. First we strolled through the beautiful markets in the city center. There you find amazing herbs and spices, a lot of nuts, handmade soaps, olives, olive oils and so much more. All local products of Greece where you can find unique gifts and souvenirs for a good price.
Later we did a walk through the center and stopped on a view very beautiful churches and chapels. So much history in downtown that is easy to miss when you walk on your own. Then you stop for a greek coffee in the most beautiful rooftop with an amazing view of the city center and acropolis. Best.stop.ever! The tour continues through very small and hidden pathes with island flair. You pass beautiful old houses (the first houses in Athens) and street art.

Our Guide George was super friendly and knowledgeable. He really likes to share the passion about his country. George is also very helpful with information what to do after the tour and were to go next. He also answers every question you have.

Thank you so much for a great morning in Athens. Its the perfect way to start your visit in Athens.

title: Non-existent customer service
body: I didn't end up going on this tour, as I got very sick the night before and had to cancel. I sent two emails and one phone call, all unanswered, telling them about this issue and asking if I could reschedule. While I sent the first email prior to the tour starting, I'm sure that the guide didn't receive it in time. The sickness wasn't their fault, but I did expect to receive some kind of response from them about rescheduling. When this didn't happen, I had to make alternative plans and sent a third email asking if there was any possibility of getting any refund. Again, no answer. An extremely frustrating experience!!!

title: 3 magical days in Kathmandu
body:
I had three wonderful experiences with Intrepid travel, the main stupa and Pashupatinath temple on day one - a local Kathmandu panoramic hike on day two and a morning tour of the Darbar square and Monkey temple on day three.

I’m very glad I booked these as I saw all the main sites of Kathmandu in just three days. The tours were well organised and I managed see everything I wanted in a short space of time.

A big thanks for Yogi who was very conscientious and knowledgeable. I enjoyed our discussions about Buddhist and Hindu culture and history a great deal.

title: Learning-filled adventure with local insight
body: The first thing I do when visiting a city is taking a tour to check off the must-dos and see which areas to come back to. This tour did exactly that, and a whole lot more! Our guide, Ataham, is incredibly knowledgeable and knows numerous historical details! Ataham is well-versed in Pre-Roman, Byzantine, ottoman and Turkish history, so we were able to really understand the history of the city. He also has a great understanding of architecture, providing great context on the many Mosques. The tour is packed, but well worth the time. Highly recommended!!

title: Intro to Cairo
body:

Once the tour started all reservations were put to the side.
This was our first of 4 tours with Mina as our guide. Mina was amazing and explained the local history so well.
He also made us feel like extremely comfortable in a city we had no idea how to explore.
The dinner was delicious and a local dish, which made me wanting to explore more of the local cuisine.
Highly recommend as an introduction to Cairo.

title: Fantastic opportunity to learn about local life
body:
I was lucky enough to be the only person on the tour so I had Gladys' full attention. We took a public bus to Lima's historic center. Gladys provided a thorough overview of the churches and government buildings along with Lima's history. The real highlight was the walk through the central market. This was what I was looking for. After a week with my friends exploring the tourist attractions around the country I wanted to see how everyday Peruvians lived. I wanted to go off the beaten path. There you can find everything for sale from food to dresses to pots and pans to bags. Unlike other markets such as Marrakech, which itself is a tourist attraction, this market had few tourists and was a true instution that locals shopped at.

I really appreciated the time and attention that Gladys provided to me. After this tour I felt that my trip to Peru was complete.

Thank you!

title: Absolutely worth it
body:
We had a fantastic experience on this Bucharest food tour, and much of that is thanks to Alex, our guide, who was truly exceptional. From the moment the tour started, Alex set the tone with his warm, friendly energy and genuine enthusiasm for both Romanian cuisine and culture. He was not only incredibly knowledgeable and informative, but also knew exactly how to engage the group, encouraging conversation and making everyone feel at ease. What could have been a simple food tasting turned into a fun, social experience, thanks to his thoughtful approach and storytelling.

Alex did a wonderful job weaving in historical and cultural context with each stop — not just talking about the dishes themselves, but also about how they fit into Romania’s broader culinary traditions and social history. He struck the perfect balance between sharing information and letting the group enjoy the moment. His passion for the city and its food came through clearly and made the whole experience feel authentic and memorable.

As for the food — it was abundant, varied, and absolutely delicious. Each stop offered something different, from traditional Romanian staples to lesser-known local specialties. We never felt rushed, and we definitely didn’t leave hungry! The pacing was just right, with plenty of time to enjoy each bite and chat with the others on the tour.

Overall, this tour was a highlight of our trip to Bucharest. Alex created a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere that brought strangers together over great food and conversation. Highly recommended for anyone looking to experience Romania through its flavors — and if you can, ask for Alex as your guide. You won’t be disappointed.

title: A Pleasant afternoon which will be remembered!
body:
Went on this tour with my partner her parents and her brother. Our tour guide Nam was great from the get go my partners parents were a little hesitant about the 13km bike ride but Nam assured us it would be fine...it was for those of you worrying about the distance the bikes are easily pedalled and the terrain is mostly flat!
As for the the scenery pedalling through the rice paddies, shrimp farms and local villages with young kids running out to say hello is charming with Nam reiterating that the Vietnamese people are some of the most friendly people on the planet. His knowledge of the local area, farming techniques was a great insight into the resilience of the people.
The tour ends on a small fishing/river boat if you have experienced and dined on one of the larger boats with the buffets and entertainment this is the pleasant opposite.
Our captain & chef Mr. Rin greeted us with a big smile and welcomed us aboard as we sailed down the river and indulged in pork skewers, grilled shrimp, chicken and finished with a beef Banh Mi (yum) this tour concludes as you sail at sunset into the lantern covered hustle and bustle of Hoi An Ancient Town & is a great way to finish the tour.
Highly recommend Nam and the Urban Adventure Team!

Went on this tour with my partner her parents and her brother. Our tour guide Nam was great from the get go my partners parents were a little hesitant about the 13km bike ride but Nam assured us it would be fine...it was for those of you worrying about the distance the bikes are easily pedalled and the terrain is mostly flat!
As for the the scenery pedalling through the rice paddies, shrimp farms and local villages with young kids running out to say hello is charming with Nam reiterating that the Vietnamese people are some of the most friendly people on the planet. His knowledge of the local area, farming techniques was a great insight into the resilience of the people.
The tour ends on a small fishing/river boat if you have experienced and dined on one of the larger boats with the buffets and entertainment this is the pleasant opposite.
Our captain & chef Mr. Rin greeted us with a big smile and welcomed us aboard as we sailed down the river and indulged in pork skewers, grilled shrimp, chicken and finished with a beef Banh Mi (yum) this tour concludes as you sail at sunset into the lantern covered hustle and bustle of Hoi An Ancient Town & is a great way to finish the tour.
Highly recommend Nam and the Urban Adventure Team!
Read more
Written 3 January 2020
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

title: Amazing Tour with an Amazing Guide
body:
Urban Adventures is a fantastic tour company. And try to get Luong Luong for your guide. She is the best guide we’ve ever had - funny, smart, informed, and takes charge so we had a great experience. She showed us the beautiful temples at the My Son UNESCO site. We leaned just the right amount of information (and it was accurate!) while moving through the site at the perfect pace.

My Son is quite beautiful and being restored at a good pace. Many countries around the world have provided funds and experts to create a beautiful site. And the Vietnamese government provides educational staff to showcase traditional music and dance.

title: 300 years of history in 2.5 entertaining hours
body:
From Congo Square where it all began to Mahogany Hall, where the finest contemporary practitioners play, this tour took us through the history of New Orleans jazz—or at least the 20th century history. That was perfect for us, since we wanted to hear about the “big picture” of New Orleans jazz.

Our guide, Adam, was knowledgeable and personable, and he had a real passion for his subject. Hopefully you get him to show you around.

title: Really interesting and filling day in the Vienna suburbs.
body:
The tour exceeded our expectations. Different foods, take the ( clean) subway or tram, eat again. During the travel and while eating, our guide Christophe was full of enthusiasm, fun facts and kept us all engaged.
A word of warning, food tour means food, lots of it. Dinner in the evening is out of the question, a light snack is all that you will be able to eat!
This tour was a high point of our visit to Vienna, seeing the life that the locals live and eating what they eat far from the tourist crowds.

title: Informative and friendly
body:
Evening Marrakech: Gastronomic and
Market Tour Inside the Medina
We met our friendly guide Brahim and the British couple that were also on the tour. Brahim explained the tour for us and we began walking around the Medina, starting in the Jewish quarter where we got to taste tea and freshly baked doughnuts, not like any we have tasted before. Thin crust and soft in the middle. Next stop was to taste different olives, spiced, green and black. Even those on the tour who didn't like olives found some of these very good. Now our guide stopped by a sweet booth where he bought some dessert for us to have after the main dinner. The main dinner was a delicious slow cooked meat in a restaurant that was already closed, since they close when everything is sold out. Our guide had reserved this for us. The last food we had was a homemade soup served at a stall in the middle of the square by the sons of the woman who cooked it earlier. Before we said goodbye, we had a spiced hot drink similar to Gluck wine or a Christmas drink. Brahim told us a lot about the culture and cuisine in Morocco. We highly recommend Brahim and this tour.
full review:

title: Walking tour
body: We took a tour yesterday with Mouhamed through urban adventures medina tour. The positives: He was nice, friendly, turned up on time and responsive. The negatives: he had very limited knowledge of the history and at least 50% of the time had not idea about how to answer even basic questions from my children and he started making up answers or ignoring. In the end it worked out that his top priority was to try to get us to buy things from his friends in the souk. Pretty disappointing considering the prices paid. A tour book would have been a better investment.

title: Nice Insight into Nepalese
body: I really enjoyed this tour! Asia is full of temples, sometimes so many that it can be temple overload. However, our guide Yogi gave us an in-depth explanation of each site we visited, gave us time to explore, and was able to answer all of our questions regarding the temples, Hinduism, and Nepal’s spiritual traditions. It was nice to have the backstory along with the beauty of Kathmandu’s religious sites. 10/10 recommend this tour and Yogi especially!!!

title: Temple highlights with a relaxing cruise
body: Started with a peaceful wander around Wat Pho, taking in the culture. Then the canal cruise which was nice too, especially stopping to feed the fish in the river. We then went to the amazing Grand Palace which was pretty mesmerising however, be warned, it is extremely crowded. We chose not to see the emerald Buddha due to the length of the queue and the heat. The entrance ticket includes a traditional Thai show at the theatre not far from the Grand Palace. There are free shuttle buses to the theatre outside. Amin was a good guide, seemed a bit rushed but probably due to the short 4 hour time frame. Very knowledgeable and funny. Overall it was a great tour, would recommend.

title: An Egypt must-do
body: I was the only person on this tour which was very much in my favour. Loay Ahmed was my guide for the day. He was full of knowledge and information which helped pass the 2 hour drive to Alexandria. Loay made sure I had express entry into all the sights, negotiating the entry lines with efficiency. He balanced guiding and free time well. It is a big day but a day trip is all you need in Alexandria. I highly recommend Urban Adventures and Loay.

title: A great way to see the pyramids and beat the crowds
body: Great trip with guide Noha. We got out early and were always ahead of the big groups. Started with a climb into the Gt Pyramid, not for the claustrophobic or infirm, then the pyramids, Sphinx and early lunch. Guide was charming and the minibus was clean and well appointed. Well worth doing though it requires a 7.30am rendezvous

title: Finding the beating heart of Bucharest
body: My husband and I were a bit hesitant when we first arrived in Bucharest and saw the communist-era buildings. However, when we joined our walking tour with Elena, she pulled back the concrete curtain and showed us the beating heart of the city. Her energy and passion was evident, and she brought the history of the place to life. There was another group with us for the walking tour, and we then had Elena to ourselves for a traditional lunch at Caru Cu Bere, a historic beer hall. She advised us on our itinerary for the rest of our trip in the countryside, and answered all of our questions. This was the perfect introduction to Romania! Highly recommend.

title: Bucharest Localities and Street Art Tour, with Tudor
body: Tudor gave us an amazing walkabout on a cold and wet Sunday morning in Bucharest. We learnt so much about local areas and hidden gems of cafes and book shops. We didn't know much about street art or understand its symbolism and beauty, but now we do. Amazing. And we heard the stories about the new, old and crumbling architecture that is part of the understated beauty that is Bucharest. Tudor was knowledgeable and enthusiastic and loves his work. We hope to visit again and select another tour with Tudor.

title: Fun way to experience authentic local cuisine

title: Connor's guided tour
body: Me and my mom went on Connor's Food and History walking tour. I have to say me and my mom have been on tours all over and this one was by far our absolute favorite. Not only was Connor so nice and welcoming in the beginning but he was also so accommodating. I am gluten free and have other food allergies as well, he made sure there was something I could eat at every stop and made sure I was enjoying the food and the tour. He knew so much about each stop and gave so much information. He kept the tour fun and interesting. I would 100% recommend this tour especially with Connor.

title: Incredible tour & seafood
body:
We had such a great time on this tour with Tim. Each place we stopped was better than the last. We loved every single thing we tried. From the chowder to the freshest blue fin sushi we’ve ever had, to oysters, and the perfect ending of the iconic lobster rolls.

Walking through the seaport area with Tim explaining the history of the fishing industry, the wharf, & south Boston was a great way to explore the area. It was a warm day so Tim prioritizing finding us a (mostly) shady route was much appreciated.

We would recommend this tour to anyone and will definitely seek out other Intrepid tours in the future.

title: Old Delhi Tour
body: I had a wonderful tour with Dikshika Chauhan to old Delhi on 2/23/2020 with my friend Lachlan. I must tell you that for one, she is a amazing tour guide who is very knowledgeable about the sights and sounds in Old Delhi. There was times I had trouble walking stairs and she held my hand to make sure I didn’t fall, or get injured especially in the busy markets of Meena Bazar, Chadni Chowk , and Humayun tomb. I really enjoyed going to the spice market and bought some incredible Masal chai at A. Kumar. I was taken by how well she was able to handle the crowds, streets and frantic traffic, I felt safe and well cared for during the whole tour. I would recommend Urban Adventures tours to anyone who wants to learn about the old Delhi culture and history, and have a fun time with a lovely, kind, tour guide, Dikshika Chauhan.

title: Teotihuacan and more!
body: This was an excellent tour that was much more than a visit to the site of Teotihuacan. Since I was the only person booked for this day day, it was essentially a private tour. My guide, Adriana, was enthusiastic and knowledgeable and I felt very confident traveling with her. In addition to seeing the ancient site, I enjoyed learning about obsidian carving from a local artist. I also learned about the many uses of the agave plant and sampled agave-based beverages. Last but not least, I had an opportunity to dine at the home of a local family. Adriana was a great guide and companion for this very memorable experience.

title: The best authentic tour experience! Come hungry and leave amazed!
body: This was a truly unforgettable experience. My guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. I learned so much about the history of the City and every question I had was answered. The food was incredible and there was a lot!! Come hungry!! The art that was hidden in the market was incredible and I would never have found this on my own. The markets were vibrant and the highlight there for me were the flower vendors. What a treat for the senses! Navigating and learning about the metro is super useful for any visitor to CDMX. Finally, the cooking lesson at the end was so fun and delicious. The family run business where it takes place was welcoming and the lovely lady who runs it was so sweet! I loved this whole experience. This is one of the very best values I have ever received from any tour at any place!

title: Feeling like a local Parisian
body:
Doriana was our wonderful guide Into the insightful work of local Parisians. We stopped by the oldest bakery and went down to the basement where the baker worked and places the breads In the woodfire oven. Stopped for delectable desserts in the medical where the oldest restaurant in Paris resides.
Another stop at Candle makers for Kings, noblemen and revolutionaries like Neapolitan. Ending the tour with some wine tasting and treats like foie gras, while local Parisians pile in for their post work aperitifs. Came back feeling like a local. The best way to experience Paris. Thank you Doriana.

title: Get a different Athens experience with a fabulous local guide.
body: A fabulous way to see Athens come alive at night with a local expert. Theo showed us places and views of the city that we'd never have found as tourists on our own. He was great fun, knowledgeable about the city, its history, culture and politics. The range of venues explored (a variety of smaller family tavernas to hip & hidden bars, funky alleyways, and rooftop bar with breathtaking views of the Acropolis) made this a must-do when you're in Athens. Food & drinks were plentiful. We felt safe and adventurous with Theo's local knowledge. Highly recommended.

title: Wonderful and Delicious Tour
body:
4 of us had the absolute pleasure of going on a wonderful 6 hour (actually went for 7 hours) private food and history tour. A very long tour I admit, but we had so much fun with Peter - world's best guide - the time flew by.
I expected we would visit a couple of coffee cafes and, in accordance with their coffee culture, spend an hour or two at each with a food stop somewhere in between. We did partake of a traditional coffee cafe, but then we did so very much more.
Peter has a gift for telling a story, for bringing history alive. He has an actors way of telling the tale which keeps you memerized and entertained. Bravo Peter, and thank you!
We ate a LOT of new tasty foods, went to places that locals go and of which tourists are unaware. All the while learning the colorful history of beautiful Vienna.
We all left the tour feeling utterly satiated, knowledgeable about Vienna's fascinating history and with a desire to visit Vienna again, physically a little tired but mentally wired, and with an abiding affection for our tour guide Peter.
It was a truly and all around wonderful experience.

title: A quirky, entertaining view of a fascinating city.
body: Our guide (Tristan) gave us an interesting tour of Melbourne It was very quirky and not what you would expect from some potted, typical tourist tour. The Skydeck whilst I first thought not interesting (we have John Hancock and Sears) was exactly HOW we were able to orient ourselves to the city. It was also really fun to get a young person's view of the city..as we are retired. It gave us a really interesting perspective on life for someone... not our age. He was very personable, low key and it was clear he wanted us to get a real feel for the city. I wish it had been longer. He had some great things to share..and it was much more lively and entertaining than the usual tour. It made me fall in love with Melbourne.

title: A really fun night out with a great guide, Flo!
body:
What a fantastic experience with our tour guide Flo, who is really passionate and informative. You could tell he loved what he was doing and he had strong personal connections with all the bar staff. Thanks so much Flo.

Even though I live in the local area I had never been to these small bars/breweries and they all had great vibes and even better craft beer. If you're looking for something a bit different and authentic, this is the perfect tour. Actually it doesn't even feel like a traditional tour - it's just a super fun night out that I would highly recommend whether you're a Melbourne local or visitor.

title: Good Tour of Casablanca- Be aware of terrible lunch
body: We did the Urban Adventure Tour with local guide Mohammed. While he was personable and friendly we found him to be condescending at times, and after speaking extensively with other guides we’ve come to realise that information he told along the way had very little factual basis which made for a charming story but didn’t give us a full picture of Casablanca. I thoroughly enjoyed what I did see during the tour and I do feel it’s a worthwhile tour to do to gain a good bearing of the city. The main let down for us is Mohammed took us for a lunch and told it was authentic when really it was a friend of his restaurant aimed at tourists. The lunch was rather expensive for Morocco and was absolutely dismal, we were trapped into paying for a full set menu despite not being that hungry. Mohammed then demanded a tip for the driver and himself - which having done yours in the past is usual. We tipped him generously and he seemed displeased. This unpleasant ending to the trip just left a bad taste in my mouth.

title: Fun way to learn about Casablanca and see the city!
body: I did the religious morning tour my first morning in Casablanca, with Bennis Hicham as my guide. I lucked out and was the only person on the tour! You get access to the Mosque, where you visit the museum and join the official tour group there. Bennis then takes you around to a few different church’s and synagogues. What stands out is the historical context that he provides during the tour—it makes the locations more meaningful when you understand the significance. There was plenty of time to take pictures, and because it was the two of us, we were able to go to a few locations that don’t typically allow the large busses of group tours inside. It was clear that Bennis wanted me to see all the highlights of Casablanca, and we had a lot of laughs during the day! The tour ended with a walk through the new Medina, where we stocked up on pastries from a local shop and drank mint tea at a cafe. Overall, it was a great way to see the city comfortably, with good company.

title: Great cooking class in the heart of the Medina
body:
This cooking class was a fantastic experience! We started with a brief tour of the local markets where Leila, our chef and guide, showed us where she buys fresh ingredients. After picking everything out, we headed back to the riad where most of the prep work was already done, so we could jump straight into cooking. Leila guided us through making chicken tagine, Moroccan salad, zalouk, bread, and mint tea, offering great tips on spices and techniques.

While the tagine cooked, we relaxed on the rooftop terrace with tea. The meal was incredible, and we enjoyed it together as a group. We also received a small bag of spices to take home. Highly recommend this class for anyone looking to experience authentic Moroccan cooking!

title: A Perfect Day in the Mekong Delta!
body:
If you're looking for a way to escape the hustle and bustle of Ho Chi Minh City and experience a completely different side of Vietnam, this Mekong Delta tour is an absolute must! From start to finish, everything ran smoothly, and all provisions were perfectly taken care of — not a single detail was overlooked.

Our guide, Thanh, was exceptional — friendly, knowledgeable, and full of fascinating insights about the region. His storytelling made the history and culture of the Delta come alive. The drive to My Tho took around 2.5 hours, and from there, our private boat ride down the Mekong River was the perfect way to begin the adventure.

We visited a local fish farm and saw firsthand how the local industries thrive here. Sampling tropical fruits on a lush island was a refreshing treat, and the stop at the coconut candy factory was both educational and delicious! Thanh explained the entire candy-making process, and of course, we got to try some for ourselves.

One of the highlights was traveling by Xe Loi through local villages, which gave us a genuine glimpse into daily life. The bee farm visit was sweet (pun intended!), and the rowing boat ride through the narrow canals was peaceful and beautiful — a moment of true tranquility.

Lunch at Vuon Dau was a culinary delight. Thanh helped us navigate the menu and introduced us to some unforgettable local dishes. It was the perfect ending to a truly immersive experience.

I highly recommend this tour to anyone wanting to see the real Vietnam beyond the city. It was informative, relaxing, and incredibly fun. Thank you, Thanh, for making it such a memorable day!

A Perfect Day in the Mekong Delta!
July 2025 • Family
If you're looking for a way to escape the hustle and bustle of Ho Chi Minh City and experience a completely different side of Vietnam, this Mekong Delta tour is an absolute must! From start to finish, everything ran smoothly, and all provisions were perfectly taken care of — not a single detail was overlooked.

Our guide, Thanh, was exceptional — friendly, knowledgeable, and full of fascinating insights about the region. His storytelling made the history and culture of the Delta come alive. The drive to My Tho took around 2.5 hours, and from there, our private boat ride down the Mekong River was the perfect way to begin the adventure.

We visited a local fish farm and saw firsthand how the local industries thrive here. Sampling tropical fruits on a lush island was a refreshing treat, and the stop at the coconut candy factory was both educational and delicious! Thanh explained the entire candy-making process, and of course, we got to try some for ourselves.

One of the highlights was traveling by Xe Loi through local villages, which gave us a genuine glimpse into daily life. The bee farm visit was sweet (pun intended!), and the rowing boat ride through the narrow canals was peaceful and beautiful — a moment of true tranquility.

Lunch at Vuon Dau was a culinary delight. Thanh helped us navigate the menu and introduced us to some unforgettable local dishes. It was the perfect ending to a truly immersive experience.

I highly recommend this tour to anyone wanting to see the real Vietnam beyond the city. It was informative, relaxing, and incredibly fun. Thank you, Thanh, for making it such a memorable day!

title: Delightful Day
body: Great day and tour of Alexandria with Mohmed O. You can tell that he really loves his job as any question I posed throughout the day was met with bright eyes and a big smile. The 2.5 drive to Alexandria was easy with a restroom break about 1/2 way. The day goes by quickly with a first stop to the catacombs then to the library, lunch and finally the fortress. Perfect tour for anyone needing the highlights covered in 1 day. I would recommend this tour and would do it again.

title: A tour to places tourists would hardly find
body:
We did the tour with our guide Andreea on a rainy afternoon with not much else to do in Bucharest and absolutely fell in love with the bars and beers she showed us. Three different locations with four little "shots" of Zaganu-Beer , three bottles at the second location and another one at the last bar, mostly "hipsterish" and well known by the locals, and in between she squeezed the history lesson about the revolution (At the Piata Revolutiei, of course).

My girlfriend and I absolutely fell in love with the city, the stories and the craft beer Andreea showed us with such passion and are sure that the 60 Euro per person are well spend money if you have four hours of time, like to walk and drink some excellent beers while getting to know some history and some of the best bars in town. We would also like to thank Andreea for the tips she gave us that evening and the follow-up email she send the next day - That was the best tour we ever had, and you were the best guide on all our tours! Thanks alot for showing us your city - We will definitely come back as soon as possible and also try other tours of "Urban Adventures"!

Denise and Thorben

title: Taste of Split
body: Absolutely amazing experience! We visited local green market early in the morning while it was vibrant with locals. We tried home made soparnik from one lady, and two types of cheese and sauerkraut from another. It was perfect intro into getting to know Split and its soul full of life. Later we explored Diocletian's palace and its substructures. The tour lasted just short of 2 hours, perfectly timed. I need to mention that based on this experience, we also did UA Dubrovnik history and Game of Thrones tour, and loved it! Thank you Mirjana!

title: Great experience
body: My husband and I loved the bike and cruise tour. It was one of the highlights of our trip. Our guide was so lovely and friendly, and very knowledgeable about the area. Her English was fantastic! It was very interesting to see how the locals live and grow their produce once you get outside the town a little. The cruise with BBQ was such a nice way to finish off the tour, coming into Hoi An old town past all the colorful boats and lanterns was beautiful, and the BBQ was delicious! I was a little worried as I haven't ridden a bike in a few years, but it was an easy ride and our guide made managing the busy traffic easy when necessary.

title: My Son Hindu Sanctuary
body: Luong was an excellent guide who provided my father and I a very enriching tour of the My Song sanctuary. Her ability to convey meaningful connections between the current population of Hoi An and the My Song area was greatly aided by her natural English capability. We had a wonderful tour through the area with all our questions promptly fulfilled. I wholeheartedly recommend booking through urban adventures to see the My Song Hindu sanctuary, especially if Luong can be your guide!

title: Tour to Nowhere
body: We waited for an hour at the pre-determined spot and no tour guide showed. After several phone calls and several minutes on hold it was determined that something slipped thru the cracks and no guide had been arranged. Another family waited with us in vain for the same tour. Our tour had been booked 48 hours in advance and confirmed by email. A rare misfire for Viator, but they did process a refund. These things happen, but the lack of any local phone number to contact the company responsible for fulfillment added to the confusion.

title: Had a great time on this tour!
body:
Emil is a fantastic guide!

The tour almost got cancelled due to weather and others ended up cancelling or rescheduling, but I joined and Emil ended up giving me a private tour.

We toured mostly east from the meet point to Barrio Escalante, which is well worth the walk! A beautiful area with good restaurants serving excellent food.

My big thanks goes to Emil. Wise beyond his years, he is extremely knowledgeable and is perfectly fluent in English. I learnt a lot of Costa Rican history from him. He is a clear communicator, friendly and positive.

title: Fantastic food tour!
body:

I can’t recommend his tour enough!

title: Best food tour EVER!
body: The best food tour EVER! The North side Little Italy food and history tour was fantastic. Nabil was very informative but more importantly, lots of fun! Having a small group made it very personal. I’m gluten free (I know-why go on a Little Italy food tour?) but Nabil went out of his way to ensure that I had alternatives and I left the tour having tasted some wonderful food and my belly was full. I highly recommend this tour and Nabil!

title: Lee is the bee's knees (the good version of the saying)
body: The walking tour with Lee was such a great way to experience a bit of Seattle I wouldn't normally see. I was in town for a conference and tagged along with my colleague and her son and I'm so glad I did. Not only were the drinks great, but Lee was engaging and knowledgeable without being snobby. He rolled with the punches (we're a rowdy trio) and made the experience really fun. Ypu can tell he likes being a guide and has respect for the craft. Highly recommend if you're in the Seattle area!
